ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a lot about alternative forms of energy, how they work, and the economic benefits of them.
intro to green energy
the different kinds of green energy systems and their techno-economic analysis
I learned a lot about types of green energy and life cycle assessments

Discussed various types of "green" energy systems, weighed their pros and cons, discussed economic impacts, their influence on the environment through the life cycle development standard of sustainability, and their long-term projections
The ways in which we can leverage current resources and technology to address climate change
Overview and intro to different methods of generating and storing green energy as well as a lifecycle assessment of each.

In this course, I learned a lot of knowledge and research related to environmental engineering and environmental protection. In the process of completing each assignment, I learned how to capture important information in the literature, how to extract information, and how to complete a complete small paper. In the final assignment, I learned how to work as a team and completed a complete paper with your help. I grew up rapidly in this course and learned a lot of knowledge, so I want to study environmental science more.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: good

strength: relatively small workload but you can still learn a lot
weakness: the professor uses data and information from 10 years ago, it's severely outdated.
I think the content of the course was wonderful and the professor was great! It would be great if the assignment expectations were a little clearer

Covers a breath of material over the course of only five weeks, units very structured and organized 
Wish we had longer class discussions on the topics

Strengths: relevant and interesting information about green energy
Weaknesses: not a very interactive course (partly due to online format), also half of your grade was on one final assignment, which was graded by a different person than all the other assignments.

In this course, the teacher's PPT is very rich, and the teacher will explain all the contents in detail in class, so that we can understand these knowledge very clearly. Complete and substantial PPT can help us review and preview very well. The interactivity of the teacher in class is also very high, and everyone can put forward and solve the problems in time. The tas will also help us with some information.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes because it enhances your understanding of the environment and renewables.
good
If you want to get an easy science credit, go for it.
Yes!

Yes - I would recommend this course to another student! Professor Khalil does a great job breaking down a multitude of different energy sources and is very clear in his lecture structure for each one. Easily the most consistent and digestable course material I've taken at Yale

Yes, especially for those non-science majors. Professor Khalil tailors the course to make it accessible to all majors, especially humanities students. Fantastic professor and very relevant knowledge to have!
Yes, the information was interesting and the workload was quite low other than the final paper, which was not bad in the grand scheme of things.

I would certainly highly recommend this course to others. Because the teacher in this course is very interesting and lively, there are a lot of rich cases and pictures. With the teacher's clear narration, this course deepened my understanding and love for environmental science. In addition, I feel very fulfilled in each course and can learn a lot of useful knowledge, which will bring good guidance for our future major choice.
